sentences.sContent: I’ve strained a muscle in my leg.
sentences.sCn: 我的腿有一处肌肉拉伤。

sentences.sContent: You’ll strain your eyes trying to read in this light.
sentences.sCn: 在这样的光线下看书会伤眼睛的。

sentences.sContent: ...Turning every single word into the target language would put too much strain on the interpreters and slow down the whole process too much...
...Others highlight the strain that undocumented immigrants place on public services...

synos.tran: 张力；[力]拉紧；负担；[外科]扭伤；血缘

phrases.pCn: 应变速率；应变率；变形速度
◎使劲拉某物；使劲做某事；努力争取

remMethod.val: 本身是词根， 意为： 拉紧

words.tran: 紧张的；勉强的；牵强附会的；滤过的
过滤器；松紧扣；用力拉的人，拉紧者
使紧张（动词strain的过去式和过去分词）

trans.tranCn: 扭伤， 拉伤； 尽力使用， 紧张； 拉紧； 尽力
trans.tranOther: to injure a muscle or part of your body by using it too much or making it work too hard

trans.tranCn: 拉紧；过劳，极度紧张；张力；扭伤，拉伤；旋律；品种，家系；气质，个性特点
trans.tranOther: worry that is caused by having to deal with a problem or work too hard over a long period of time
